intro: Miconia eugenioides, commonly known as the velvetleaf miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that are typically dark green in color. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Miconia eugenioides is often found in moist, shaded forest understories and can grow up to several meters in height.
